column4: but I guess I have to configure them, and i don't even know where to begin with doing that
wlan0... jord, there is nothing listed as that
My only devices listed in network settings are eth0 (My internal wireless card), eth1 (My uncofigured network inteface card) and eth2 (my PCMCIA card)
When I try to boot it just stalls on *Confiruging network interfaces for minutes
What Ubuntu just destroy my drivers for my card?
I don't get why it woudln't work
I think you made that point an hour or two ago.
Why don't you call it a night, buy a USB pen drive, and come back tomorrow.
Call it a night and chill, dude.
There's a few things here which may come as some solace.  Among them, Linux doesn't tend to randomly reorganize itself from out from under you.
What's wrong with SoCal is not enough rain, earthquakes, fires, or landslides.
